titlestmt.titleproper: Community Service Organization History Project records
Guide to Community Service Organization History Project records M1669

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2016-05-23 14:18:52 -0700.

repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

did.unittitle: Community Service Organization. History Project records
did.abstract: The Community Service Organization History Project papers includes oral history interviews and other media as well as files from the CSO itself, especially pertaining to its Bakersfield Chapter, 1955-2002.
did.physloc: Special Collections and University Archives materials are stored offsite and must be paged 36-48 hours in advance. For more information on paging collections, see the department's website: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/spc.html.
did.langmaterial: Most of the materials in this collection are in English. Some of the correspondence and other records are in Spanish.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Community Service Organization was an important California Latino civil rights organization, most famous for training Cesar Chavez. It was founded in 1948 by Fred Ross, Antonio Rios and Edward Roybal to empower immigrants through such programs such as voter registration drives, citizenship classes, lawsuits and legislative campaigns.

The Community Service Organization focused on voter registration drives, citizenship classes, lawsuits and legislative campaigns. The chapters of the CSO also created and ran substance abuse treatment programs, college scholarships, summer camps, death benefit societies and credit unions. CSO also created substance abuse treatment programs, college scholarships and credit unions.

accessrestrict.head: Access to Collection
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Audio-visual materials are not available in original format, and must be reformatted to a digital use copy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 15 oral history interviews : 13 DVDs, 2005-2009; Fred Ross memorial : 2 DVDs, 1992; "The Leadership Lessons of the CSO" : 3 DVDs. Files pertaining to the history project, 1997-2009. Files primarily pertaining to the Bakersfield Chapter of the CSO, 1955-2002.

Bakersfield Chapter materials include correspondence, Committee reports, financial reports, memorandums, Board Meeting minutes and agendas, newsletters, newspaper clippings, photographs, member lists, and by-laws.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Community Service Organization. History Project records. M1669. Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: While Special Collections is the owner of the physical and digital items, permission to examine collection materials is not an authorization to publish. These materials are made available for use in research, teaching, and private study. Any transmission or reproduction beyond that allowed by fair use requires permission from the owners of rights, heir(s) or assigns.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes: By-Laws of CSO's Death Benefit Society, youth reports, materials on the Kern County Conference on Youth Participation in Community Affairs, Chapter reports, Candidate Day Committee Reports, list of members and brochure for the Rosicrucian Science Museum and Planetarium. Also includes correspondence from the office of California Attorney General, Edmund Brown.

scopecontent.p: Includes meeting minutes, agendas, correspondence, reports and financial statements.

did.unittitle: CSO Bakersfield Chapter: Constitution, By-Laws and Parliamentary Authority. Accession 2013-195

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials primarily consist of photocopies of David Burciaga and Cesar Chavez correspondence with Local, State and Federal government agencies and politicians. Includes letters from Congressman Harlan Hagen from Californi and Adlai Stevenson. One of the items is stamped, "Reproductions. The Collections of Archives of Labor and Urban Affairs, University Archives, Wayne State University".

did.unittitle: CSO Bakersfield Chapter: Correspondence - Incoming. Accession 2013-195

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence with local, state and federal government agencies and politicians, local organizations, and colleges. Also includes memorandums, list of members, materials on the De Colores and Substance Abuse Programs, financial statements, reports and Executive Board Meetings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include, Kern County High School District Board of Trustees' agenda, materials for the Kern County Education Summit and Kern County School Board District map with voting totals.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Material include, correspondence about the CSO's Death Benefit Society, City of Bakersfield Council Agenda, correspondence, members mailing lists, Baker Street Street Faire, a report on antibiotics, CSO Board Meeting minutes, newspaper clippings, photocopies of Ahora, newsletters, a letter from the United Farm Workers of America, and the Report on Bakersfield Chapter to the State Convention,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include, NAACP Freedom Award citation, newsletters, newspaper clippings, photographs, and Kern County Proclamation of CSO Day.
